newsitem.title: CHINA: China forcibly disperses protesters outside gov't.
newsitem.headline: China forcibly disperses protesters outside gov't.

text.p: Hundreds of Chinese police on Friday forcibly dispersed protesters staging a sit-in outside the headquarters of the Communist Party and government.
Each protester was grabbed by two police and forced aboard a bus as visiting dignitaries emerged in limousines from the tightly-guarded Zhongnanhai government compound in the heart of Beijing.
One elderly man tried to get off the bus but was pushed back by police.
A few protesters walked away to avoid being loaded onto the buses. One shouted: "I have no home to go to." "What crime have we, the people, committed?" another cried.
Police ordered local residents to return to their homes and urged curious onlookers to disperse.
